name: Fried Cauliflower (Egyptian Style)
author: Marmar
summary: The smaller the florets the crispier and yummier! To get even crispier florets, add a couple of teaspoons cornmeal to the batter.
ingredients: ¼ cup milk, or as needed
2 cups vegetable oil, or as needed
directions: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil; add 2 teaspoons cumin to boiling water
Cook cauliflower florets, working in batches, in the boiling water until cooked but still crisp, 1 to 2 minutes
Remove with a slotted spoon and cool on a plate
Blend flour, egg, garlic, 1 teaspoon cumin, tomato paste, and salt in a blender or food processor until smooth; thin with milk as needed
Heat oil in a deep skillet to about 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Dip cauliflower florets in the batter; fry battered cauliflower in the hot oil, working in batches, until cauliflower is golden and crispy, 6 to 8 minutes
Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate
